intro: Galium olivetorum, commonly known as the olive wood creeper, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes, forming dense mats. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in early spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Galium olivetorum is native to Europe and is often found in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
